title: Equivalence Test
label1: To compare two variables either choose a grouping variable (two levels only) or a second (independent or paired) variable
label2: How to treat the second variable if selected
groupingNeededRad: The second variable selected is a grouping variable
referenceGpValue: Type in the group value to be used as reference
pairedTestRad: Perform Paired Test - the second variables selected is paired
lower: Lower limit - numeric value of lower equivalence bound
upper: Upper limit - numeric value of upper equivalence bound
smdChk: Equivalence bounds specified in SMD (Standardized Mean Difference)
HedgesCorrectionChk: Compute Hedges correction automatically (otherwise shows Cohen's d)
plotChk: Consonance plot (this may take a while to display the plot)

help.title: Equivalence Test
help.body:
Description
Function to perform Equivalence test or minimal effects test (MET)

For the detail help - use R help(t_TOST, package = TOSTER)

To try this, you may load the dataset called iris with Load Dataset menu by selecting iris dataset from the second dropdown (type quickly iris)

Select Sepal.Length as the first variable and (optionally) choose Sepal.Width as the second variable, and select Paired test
type 5.5 as the lower bound and 8.5 as the upper bound for the Equivalence margin, click run


Follow the tutorial at https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/TOSTER/vignettes/IntroTOSTt.html
